text: Jessie Smith (1941 – February 4, 2021) was an American R&B; singer. She began her career singing with musician Benny Sharp, recording as Little Miss Jessie. Smith was best known as one of the original Ikettes in the Ike & Tina Turner Revue. She later sang backing vocals for many artists, including Dr. John, Paul Williams, Al Kooper, José Feliciano, and Leon Ware. Smith died on February 4, 2021.Robbie Montgomery of 'Sweetie Pie's' Mourns the Passing of Her Best Friend Jesse Smith Lucas ==References== ==Other websites== * Jessie Smith on AllMusic Category:1941 deaths Category:2021 deaths Category:American gospel singers Category:American R&B; singers Category:Singers from St. Louis, Missouri
title: Jessie Smith (singer)
